pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:0.4: The sub-chapter on evenly all around
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:0.5: 8. The second training rule on lowered eyes
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were sitting in inhabited areas, looking here and there. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:1.3: “‘I will sit with lowered eyes in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:1.4: Sitting in an inhabited area, one should lower one’s eyes, looking the distance of a plows-length ahead.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, sits in an inhabited area, looking here and there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:1.13: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:1.14: The eighth training rule is finished.
